intro: Faramea ramosiana, commonly known as the creeping faramea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments. Faramea ramosiana is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
